title: John Deere New Generation and Generation II Tractors: History, Models, Variations & Specifications 1960s-1970s (Tractor Legacy Series)
features: In the 1960s and 1970s, John Deere’s tractors evolved dramatically from small machines into large, powerful tractors with modern advances and muscular engines; it was a period of the greatest changes since the 1920s. Deere christened these tractors the New Generation. This book in the Tractor Legacy series examines these Big Green machines in detail, with archival and current photography of restored tractors, a thorough historical text, and details of model specifications and variations.
description: Here for the first time is the complete, illustrated history of John Deere's revolutionary New Generation tractors that set a new benchmark around the globe.

In the 1960s and 1970s, Deere’s tractors evolved dramatically from its small-yet-faithful two-cylinder "Johnny Popper" machines into large, powerful tractors with modern advances, ergonomics, muscular engines, and safety features that forever altered the whole industry; it was a period of the greatest changes since the 1920s. Deere christened these tractors the New Generation.
John Deere New Generation and Generation II Tractors: History, Models, Variations & Specifications 1960s–1970s

examines these Big Green machines in detail, with vivid, color photographs of restored tractors; archival images of ads, brochures, and tractors in action; and a thorough historical text that tells the story of this important chapter in the great John Deere legacy.
--This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title.
John Dietz is a writer and photographer based in Arden, Manitoba, Canada. He has authored the books
, and he writes for several agriculture magazines.
--This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title.
